message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about the exposure bias problem in neural language generation models, which is a central problem in natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes metrics to quantify the impact of exposure bias, which involves machine learning and optimization techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The paper experiments with LSTM/transformer models, which are commonly used in neural language generation, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper includes results for a seq2seq machine translation task, which involves computer vision techniques, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a less likely but still possible sub-category.
